comments.text:
Actually, there were special effects involved. For the far away shots, they 
were actually hitting a green board. 

However, for the close up shots, the cast took turns throwing the ball in 
Matt's face. They also used two cameras. One for the close ups, and the 
other to record the same thing from far away so that it looked like the 
ball really did hit him in the face. 

As for the blood, that's just really good makeup.

+Hsu Serena We're not all laughing because the guy's in pain :P. It's the 
commenters and how everything happened.
Every single thing he did resulted in getting hit in the face even though 
he tried to do the opposite, the irony in that is amusing. It's also how 
everyone else on his team was such an idiot and the doctor was hilarious. 
It's also how the goalie  himself reacted to it that was funny. So no, I 
should not be "condemned" for sharing this video saying it's hilarious, and 
you don't know us so you really can't say that either. It's really very 
condescending. This is is also the wrong use of the word "bully." I'm also 
willing to bet the people who laughed at this also felt sorry for Neymar 
when he got that horrible back injury during the game. Some might have 
laughed saying it looked funny before understanding how serious it became.

Commentator #1, "Welcome back to our coverage of the game of the year 
between Yale and North Carolina."
    #2"If you're just joining us, we have witnessed an unbelievably well 
fought match tonight, and it's come down to penalty kicks. For Yale, taking 
the first approach." 
    Both: "OH THERE IT IS!"
   #1, "Spectacular! North Carolina's Goal kick Richonds just left one now, 
so now the burden rests on Yale's Scott Sterling."
  #2 "Here comes nerves of steel that man, dealing with more pressure now 
than a submarine."
#1   "Indeed. Home crowd showing some appreciation. Johnson places the ball 
on the spot, getting ready. That man literally has a cannon for a leg,"
  #2 "Yes he does."
   #1 "Here he goes winding up for the shot and,"
 Both "OH! 
 #1 "The cannon has fired and hit Sterling directly to the face."
 #2 "We clocked that at a stunning 116 kilometers per hour."
#1 "Now that's a lot of miles per hour."
 #2 "Little chance that man's nose is not broken right now."
 #1 "Oh indeed. Now Sterling getting checked out for that one. Spectacular 
save though, but sadly he's not out of the woods yet."

top_comment.text:
*史上最倒霉足球守门员 千万人捧腹大笑*

在最近走红的一段足球赛影片中，一名倒霉的守门员接连5次被对方所踢罚球击中脸部，伤痕累累，但却帮助队友赢得比赛。（视频撷图）

【大纪元2014年11月26日讯】（大纪元记者陈俊村综合报导）最近网上流传一段十分爆笑的足球赛影片，片中一名守门员接连5次被对方所踢罚球击中脸部，无论他怎么闪躲，球就是会击中他的脸。尽管他最终躺着被抬出场，但他因为成功阻挡了对方的攻击，致使自己的队伍获胜，算得上是牺牲小我，完成大我。

在这场“2014年大学男子足球赛”中，美国耶鲁大学牛头犬队（Yale Bulldogs）与北卡罗来纳大学柏油脚跟队（North Carolina 
Tar Heels）踢和，于是以12码罚球一决胜负。

身穿蓝色球衣的耶鲁队先拔头筹，踢进第一球。之后轮到北卡队反击，但该队球员的罚球击中耶鲁队守门员的脸。经医护人员检查无碍后，该名守门员负伤继续比赛。不料在对方踢第二球时，此守门员又被球砸到脸，当场晕眩，被医护人员拖出场外。

而在接下来的第三球、第四球和第五球中，无论这名倒霉的守门员怎么闪躲或哀求，对方的球就是会击中他的脸，仿佛球有长眼睛，专门往他的脸飞去。有球评在片中幽默地说，他有不可思议的直觉，居然知道要在哪个位置才能挡到球。

由于这名守门员的牺牲，而且坚持到底，耶鲁队最终以1:0赢得比赛，他的队友高兴地用担架将他和奖杯一起抬出场外。

这其实不是真的比赛转播，而是YouTube网站的BYUtv频道所拍摄的搞笑影片。本片自11月14日上传以来，观看人次已经有1,200万次，似乎可以用爆红来形容。

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8F9jXYOH2c0

责任编辑：林琮文﻿
